meanings.definition: To remove a case or covering from something.
meanings.sent1: She carefully uncased the fragile vase to display it on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The detective uncased the evidence to examine it closely.
meanings.sent3: After much struggle, he finally uncased the stubborn pickle jar.
meanings.sent4: The magician uncased the hidden rabbit from the hat, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, she uncased the sword, ready for battle.

meanings.definition: To reveal or expose something previously hidden or protected.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist uncased the ancient artifact, revealing its intricate details.
meanings.sent2: The storm uncased the buried treasure chest, much to the excitement of the beachcombers.
meanings.sent3: As the curtain rose, it uncased the grand stage set for the play.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise uncased the beauty of the landscape, painting the sky with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The investigation uncased the truth, bringing closure to the mystery.
